info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 27 at 1:41PM MST until May 28 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING BELOW 4000 FEET... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning below 4000 feet, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures 105 to 108. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Below 4000 feet for the Excessive Heat Warning, all of the Grand Canyon for the Wind Advisory. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, until 7 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Advisory, from 9 AM to 9 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. In addition, winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Day hikers on Bright Angel Trail should descend no farther than 1 1/2 miles. Between 11 am and 7 pm...physical activity is discouraged. Hikers should attempt to be out of the canyon...at Indian Garden or Bright Angel campgrounds between these hours. All hikers should have adequate gear...including a wide-brimmed hat...sunscreen...salty snacks...sufficient water and electrolyte mix. Doubling your calorie intake helps maintain your energy. Hike smart. Due to the expected windy conditions, use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
